node.title: Department of Justice fined over attacks on staff, including infamous guitar 'scalping'
node.alt: Sign outside the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre in central Victoria.
node.description: The Department of Justice and Community Safety has  been convicted and fined $100,000, for failing to provide a safe workplace at its youth justice facilities
node.content:
["Victoria's Department of Justice and Community Safety (DJCS) has been fined $100,000\u00a0for failing to provide a safe workplace at its youth justice facilities, after two staff members were seriously injured in 2018.", "But a lawyer representing a female worker who was bashed with a guitar\u00a0told the ABC the same authority that prosecuted DJSC over the incident\u00a0had\u00a0determined\u00a0the injury as not serious.", "Readers are advised this article contains a graphic image.", "WorkSafe previously\u00a0rejected an application by Belinda Henry for a Serious Injury Certificate\u00a0to enable her to sue for her injuries.", "\"Belinda's actually had seven\u00a0surgeries as a result of this incident,\" lawyer Lachlan Singe told the ABC.", "Mr Singe said she had\u00a0applied to the County Court to prove her injury was serious.", "The department was convicted of two breaches of the Occupational Health and Safety Act in the Melbourne Magistrates Court today.", "It pleaded guilty to failing to provide a safe workplace and failing to provide information and instruction to its employees\u00a0to enable them to perform their work safely.", "", "
Belinda Henry has had seven surgeries after the attack.(Supplied)
", "Magistrate Marita Altman fined the department $80,000 for the incident at the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre and $20,000 for an incident at the Parkville Youth Justice Centre in 2018.", "The convictions follow\u00a0a fresh attack on a worker at the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre on Wednesday in what the ABC understands is at least the 13th assault on a staff member at the site this year.", "Police said the 36-year-old woman was taken to Bendigo Hospital with \"potentially serious upper-body injuries\"\u00a0and a 16-year-old inmate is expected to be charged.\u00a0", "On January 24, 2018, a\u00a0young person smashed Belinda Henry's head with a guitar.", "Described at the time as the guitar \"scalping\" incident, it was considered as one of the most violent incidents in the history of Youth Justice.", "The court found the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre failed to implement two policies relating to guitars:", "A second, stricter guitar policy related specifically to the young person who attacked Ms Henry, as they had previously hit two members of the Safety Emergency Response Team with a guitar three weeks earlier.", "Mr Singe described the injuries as among the worst he had\u00a0seen from a workplace.", "", "
The Malmsbury centre holds about 60 young adults,\u00a0including high-risk violent offenders.(ABC News)
", "At Parkville Youth Justice Centre, a young person threw a cup of boiling water at a staff member's face\u00a0then punched him.", "The staff member was taken to the Alfred Hospital\u00a0with facial burns and developed post-traumatic stress disorder.", "WorkSafe inspectors found the young person should not have been allowed to take the boiling water out of the kitchen, as there was a policy in place in which young people were not allowed to take hot drinks out of the kitchen."]
